speaker: PRINCE
text: Ned, prithee, come out of that fat room and

speaker: PRINCE
text: lend me thy hand to laugh a little.

speaker: POINS
text: Where hast been, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE
text: With three or four loggerheads amongst three

speaker: PRINCE
text: or fourscore hogsheads. I have sounded the very

speaker: PRINCE
text: bass string of humility. Sirrah, I am sworn brother

speaker: PRINCE
text: to a leash of drawers, and can call them all by their

speaker: PRINCE
text: Christian names, as Tom, Dick, and Francis. They

speaker: PRINCE
text: take it already upon their salvation that though I be

speaker: PRINCE
text: but Prince of Wales, yet I am the king of courtesy,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and tell me flatly I am no proud jack, like Falstaff,

speaker: PRINCE
text: but a Corinthian, a lad of mettle, a good boy—by

speaker: PRINCE
text: the Lord, so they call me—and when I am king of

speaker: PRINCE
text: England, I shall command all the good lads in

speaker: PRINCE
text: Eastcheap. They call drinking deep “dyeing scarlet,”

speaker: PRINCE
text: and when you breathe in your watering, they

speaker: PRINCE
text: cry “Hem!” and bid you “Play it off!” To conclude, I

speaker: PRINCE
text: am so good a proficient in one quarter of an hour

speaker: PRINCE
text: that I can drink with any tinker in his own language

speaker: PRINCE
text: during my life. I tell thee, Ned, thou hast lost much

speaker: PRINCE
text: honor that thou wert not with me in this action; but,

speaker: PRINCE
text: sweet Ned—to sweeten which name of Ned, I give

speaker: PRINCE
text: thee this pennyworth of sugar, clapped even now

speaker: PRINCE
text: into my hand by an underskinker, one that never

speaker: PRINCE
text: spake other English in his life than “Eight shillings

speaker: PRINCE
text: and sixpence,” and “You are welcome,” with this

speaker: PRINCE
text: shrill addition, “Anon, anon, sir.—Score a pint of

speaker: PRINCE
text: bastard in the Half-moon,” or so. But, Ned, to

speaker: PRINCE
text: drive away the time till Falstaff come, I prithee, do

speaker: PRINCE
text: thou stand in some by-room while I question my

speaker: PRINCE
text: puny drawer to what end he gave me the sugar, and

speaker: PRINCE
text: do thou never leave calling “Francis,” that his tale

speaker: PRINCE
text: to me may be nothing but “Anon.” Step aside, and

speaker: PRINCE
text: I’ll show thee a precedent.

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou art perfect.

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, anon, sir.—Look down into the Pomgarnet,

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Ralph.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Come hither, Francis.

speaker: FRANCIS
text: My lord?

speaker: PRINCE
text: How long hast thou to serve, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Forsooth, five years, and as much as to—

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Five year! By ’r Lady, a long lease for the

speaker: PRINCE
text: clinking of pewter! But, Francis, darest thou be

speaker: PRINCE
text: so valiant as to play the coward with thy indenture,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and show it a fair pair of heels, and run

speaker: PRINCE
text: from it?

speaker: FRANCIS
text: O Lord, sir, I’ll be sworn upon all the books

speaker: FRANCIS
text: in England, I could find in my heart—

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How old art thou, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Let me see. About Michaelmas next, I shall

speaker: FRANCIS
text: be—

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, sir.—Pray, stay a little, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Nay, but hark you, Francis, for the sugar thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: gavest me—’twas a pennyworth, was ’t not?

speaker: FRANCIS
text: O Lord, I would it had been two!

speaker: PRINCE
text: I will give thee for it a thousand pound. Ask

speaker: PRINCE
text: me when thou wilt, and thou shalt have it.

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, anon.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Anon, Francis? No, Francis. But tomorrow,

speaker: PRINCE
text: Francis; or, Francis, o’ Thursday; or indeed, Francis,

speaker: PRINCE
text: when thou wilt. But, Francis—

speaker: FRANCIS
text: My lord?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Wilt thou rob this leathern-jerkin, crystal-button,

speaker: PRINCE
text: not-pated, agate-ring, puke-stocking, caddis-garter,

speaker: PRINCE
text: smooth-tongue, Spanish-pouch—

speaker: FRANCIS
text: O Lord, sir, who do you mean?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why then, your brown bastard is your only

speaker: PRINCE
text: drink, for look you, Francis, your white canvas

speaker: PRINCE
text: doublet will sully. In Barbary, sir, it cannot come to

speaker: PRINCE
text: so much.

speaker: FRANCIS
text: What, sir?

speaker: POINS
text: Francis!

speaker: PRINCE
text: Away, you rogue! Dost thou not hear them

speaker: PRINCE
text: call?

speaker: VINTNER
text: What, stand’st thou still and hear’st such a

speaker: VINTNER
text: calling? Look to the guests within.

speaker: VINTNER
text: My lord, old Sir John with half a dozen more are at

speaker: VINTNER
text: the door. Shall I let them in?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Let them alone awhile, and then open the

speaker: PRINCE
text:
door. 
                Vintner
                 
                exits
                .
               Poins!

speaker: POINS
text: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Sirrah, Falstaff and the rest of the thieves are

speaker: PRINCE
text: at the door. Shall we be merry?

speaker: POINS
text: As merry as crickets, my lad. But hark you,

speaker: POINS
text: what cunning match have you made with this jest

speaker: POINS
text: of the drawer. Come, what’s the issue?

speaker: PRINCE
text: I am now of all humors that have showed

speaker: PRINCE
text: themselves humors since the old days of Goodman

speaker: PRINCE
text: Adam to the pupil age of this present twelve

speaker: PRINCE
text: o’clock at midnight.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What’s o’clock, Francis?

speaker: FRANCIS
text: Anon, anon, sir.

speaker: PRINCE
text: That ever this fellow should have fewer words

speaker: PRINCE
text: than a parrot, and yet the son of a woman! His

speaker: PRINCE
text: industry is upstairs and downstairs, his eloquence

speaker: PRINCE
text: the parcel of a reckoning. I am not yet of Percy’s

speaker: PRINCE
text: mind, the Hotspur of the north, he that kills me

speaker: PRINCE
text: some six or seven dozen of Scots at a breakfast,

speaker: PRINCE
text: washes his hands, and says to his wife “Fie upon

speaker: PRINCE
text: this quiet life! I want work.” “O my sweet Harry,”

speaker: PRINCE
text: says she, “how many hast thou killed today?”

speaker: PRINCE
text: “Give my roan horse a drench,” says he, and answers

speaker: PRINCE
text: “Some fourteen,” an hour after. “A trifle, a

speaker: PRINCE
text: trifle.” I prithee, call in Falstaff. I’ll play Percy,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and that damned brawn shall play Dame Mortimer

speaker: PRINCE
text: his wife. “Rivo!” says the drunkard. Call in

speaker: PRINCE
text: Ribs, call in Tallow.

speaker: POINS
text: Welcome, Jack. Where hast thou been?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A plague of all cowards, I say, and a vengeance

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: too! Marry and amen!—Give me a cup of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sack, boy.—Ere I lead this life long, I’ll sew netherstocks

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and mend them, and foot them too. A plague

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of all cowards!—Give me a cup of sack, rogue!—Is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: there no virtue extant?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Didst thou never see Titan kiss a dish of

speaker: PRINCE
text: butter—pitiful-hearted Titan!—that melted at the

speaker: PRINCE
text: sweet tale of the sun’s? If thou didst, then behold

speaker: PRINCE
text: that compound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You rogue, here’s lime in this

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sack too.—There is nothing but roguery to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: found in villainous man, yet a coward is worse than

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a cup of sack with lime in it. A villainous coward! Go

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thy ways, old Jack. Die when thou wilt. If manhood,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good manhood, be not forgot upon the face of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Earth, then am I a shotten herring. There lives not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: three good men unhanged in England, and one of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: them is fat and grows old, God help the while. A bad

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: world, I say. I would I were a weaver. I could sing

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: psalms, or anything. A plague of all cowards, I say

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: still.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How now, woolsack, what mutter you?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A king’s son! If I do not beat thee out of thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: kingdom with a dagger of lath, and drive all thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: subjects afore thee like a flock of wild geese, I’ll

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: never wear hair on my face more. You, Prince of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Wales!

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, you whoreson round man, what’s the

speaker: PRINCE
text: matter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Are not you a coward? Answer me to that—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and Poins there?

speaker: POINS
text: Zounds, you fat paunch, an you call me coward,

speaker: POINS
text: by the Lord, I’ll stab thee.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I call thee coward? I’ll see thee damned ere

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I call thee coward, but I would give a thousand

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pound I could run as fast as thou canst. You are

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: straight enough in the shoulders you care not who

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sees your back. Call you that backing of your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: friends? A plague upon such backing! Give me them

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that will face me.—Give me a cup of sack.—I am a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rogue if I drunk today.

speaker: PRINCE
text: O villain, thy lips are scarce wiped since thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: drunk’st last.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
All is one for that. 
                (
                He
                 
                drinketh
                .
                )
               A plague of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all cowards, still say I.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What’s the matter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What’s the matter? There be four of us here

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: have ta’en a thousand pound this day morning.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Where is it, Jack, where is it?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Where is it? Taken from us it is. A hundred

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon poor four of us.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, a hundred, man?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am a rogue if I were not at half-sword

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: with a dozen of them two hours together. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’scaped by miracle. I am eight times thrust through

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the doublet, four through the hose, my buckler

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cut through and through, my sword hacked like

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a handsaw. Ecce signum! I never dealt better since

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I was a man. All would not do. A plague of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all cowards! Let them speak.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: If they speak more or

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: less than truth, they are villains, and the sons of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: darkness.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Speak, sirs, how was it?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: We four set upon some dozen.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Sixteen at least, my lord.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: And bound them.

speaker: PETO
text: No, no, they were not bound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You rogue, they were bound, every man of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: them, or I am a Jew else, an Ebrew Jew.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: As we were sharing, some six or seven

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: fresh men set upon us.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And unbound the rest, and then come in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: other.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, fought you with them all?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: All? I know not what you call all, but if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fought not with fifty of them I am a bunch of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: radish. If there were not two- or three-and-fifty

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon poor old Jack, then am I no two-legged

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: creature.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Pray God you have not murdered some of

speaker: PRINCE
text: them.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Nay, that’s past praying for. I have peppered

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: two of them. Two I am sure I have paid, two rogues

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in buckram suits. I tell thee what, Hal, if I tell thee a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lie, spit in my face, call me horse. Thou knowest my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: old ward. Here I lay, and thus I bore my point. Four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rogues in buckram let drive at me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, four? Thou said’st but two even now.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Four, Hal, I told thee four.

speaker: POINS
text: Ay, ay, he said four.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: These four came all afront, and mainly

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thrust at me. I made me no more ado, but took all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: their seven points in my target, thus.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Seven? Why there were but four even now.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: In buckram?

speaker: POINS
text: Ay, four in buckram suits.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Seven by these hilts, or I am a villain else.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Prithee, let him alone. We shall have

speaker: PRINCE
text: more anon.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou hear me, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Ay, and mark thee too, Jack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Do so, for it is worth the listening to. These

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: nine in buckram that I told thee of—

speaker: PRINCE
text: So, two more already.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Their points being broken—

speaker: POINS
text: Down fell their hose.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Began to give me ground, but I followed me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: close, came in foot and hand, and, with a thought,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: seven of the eleven I paid.

speaker: PRINCE
text: O monstrous! Eleven buckram men grown out

speaker: PRINCE
text: of two!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: But as the devil would have it, three misbegotten

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: knaves in Kendal green came at my back,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and let drive at me, for it was so dark, Hal, that thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: couldst not see thy hand.

speaker: PRINCE
text: These lies are like their father that begets

speaker: PRINCE
text: them, gross as a mountain, open, palpable. Why,

speaker: PRINCE
text: thou claybrained guts, thou knotty-pated fool, thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: whoreson, obscene, greasy tallow-catch—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What, art thou mad? Art thou mad? Is not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the truth the truth?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, how couldst thou know these men in

speaker: PRINCE
text: Kendal green when it was so dark thou couldst not

speaker: PRINCE
text: see thy hand? Come, tell us your reason. What sayest

speaker: PRINCE
text: thou to this?

speaker: POINS
text: Come, your reason, Jack, your reason.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What, upon compulsion? Zounds, an I were

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: at the strappado or all the racks in the world, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: would not tell you on compulsion. Give you a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: reason on compulsion? If reasons were as plentiful

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: as blackberries, I would give no man a reason upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: compulsion, I.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I’ll be no longer guilty of this sin. This sanguine

speaker: PRINCE
text: coward, this bed-presser, this horse-backbreaker,

speaker: PRINCE
text: this huge hill of flesh—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’Sblood, you starveling, you elfskin, you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dried neat’s tongue, you bull’s pizzle, you stockfish!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: O, for breath to utter what is like thee! You tailor’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: yard, you sheath, you bowcase, you vile standing

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: tuck—

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, breathe awhile, and then to it again, and

speaker: PRINCE
text: when thou hast tired thyself in base comparisons,

speaker: PRINCE
text: hear me speak but this.

speaker: POINS
text: Mark, Jack.

speaker: PRINCE
text: We two saw you four set on four, and bound

speaker: PRINCE
text: them and were masters of their wealth. Mark now

speaker: PRINCE
text: how a plain tale shall put you down. Then did we

speaker: PRINCE
text: two set on you four and, with a word, outfaced you

speaker: PRINCE
text: from your prize, and have it, yea, and can show it

speaker: PRINCE
text: you here in the house. And, Falstaff, you carried

speaker: PRINCE
text: your guts away as nimbly, with as quick dexterity,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and roared for mercy, and still run and roared, as

speaker: PRINCE
text: ever I heard bull-calf. What a slave art thou to hack

speaker: PRINCE
text: thy sword as thou hast done, and then say it was in

speaker: PRINCE
text: fight! What trick, what device, what starting-hole

speaker: PRINCE
text: canst thou now find out to hide thee from this open

speaker: PRINCE
text: and apparent shame?

speaker: POINS
text: Come, let’s hear, Jack. What trick hast thou

speaker: POINS
text: now?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: By the Lord, I knew you as well as he that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: made you. Why, hear you, my masters, was it for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me to kill the heir apparent? Should I turn upon the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: true prince? Why, thou knowest I am as valiant as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hercules, but beware instinct. The lion will not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: touch the true prince. Instinct is a great matter.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I was now a coward on instinct. I shall think

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the better of myself, and thee, during my life—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I for a valiant lion, and thou for a true prince.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: But, by the Lord, lads, I am glad you have the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: money.—Hostess, clap to the doors.—Watch tonight,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pray tomorrow. Gallants, lads, boys, hearts

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of gold, all the titles of good fellowship come to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you. What, shall we be merry? Shall we have a play

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: extempore?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Content, and the argument shall be thy running

speaker: PRINCE
text: away.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Ah, no more of that, Hal, an thou lovest me.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O Jesu, my lord the Prince—

speaker: PRINCE
text: How now, my lady the hostess, what sayst thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: to me?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Marry, my lord, there is a nobleman of the

speaker: HOSTESS
text: court at door would speak with you. He says he

speaker: HOSTESS
text: comes from your father.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Give him as much as will make him a royal

speaker: PRINCE
text: man and send him back again to my mother.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What manner of man is he?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: An old man.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What doth Gravity out of his bed at midnight?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shall I give him his answer?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Prithee do, Jack.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Faith, and I’ll send him packing.

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Now, sirs. 
                To
                 
                Gadshill
                .
               By ’r Lady, you fought

speaker: PRINCE
text: fair.—So did you, Peto.—So did you, Bardolph.—

speaker: PRINCE
text: You are lions too. You ran away upon instinct. You

speaker: PRINCE
text: will not touch the true prince. No, fie!

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Faith, I ran when I saw others run.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Faith, tell me now in earnest, how came Falstaff’s

speaker: PRINCE
text: sword so hacked?

speaker: PETO
text: Why, he hacked it with his dagger and said he

speaker: PETO
text: would swear truth out of England but he would

speaker: PETO
text: make you believe it was done in fight, and persuaded

speaker: PETO
text: us to do the like.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Yea, and to tickle our noses with speargrass

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: to make them bleed, and then to beslubber our

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: garments with it, and swear it was the blood of true

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: men. I did that I did not this seven year before: I

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: blushed to hear his monstrous devices.

speaker: PRINCE
text: O villain, thou stolest a cup of sack eighteen

speaker: PRINCE
text: years ago, and wert taken with the manner, and ever

speaker: PRINCE
text: since thou hast blushed extempore. Thou hadst fire

speaker: PRINCE
text: and sword on thy side, and yet thou ran’st away.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What instinct hadst thou for it?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: My lord, do you see these meteors? Do you

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: behold these exhalations?

speaker: PRINCE
text: I do.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: What think you they portend?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Hot livers and cold purses.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Choler, my lord, if rightly taken.

speaker: PRINCE
text: No. If rightly taken, halter.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Here comes lean Jack. Here comes bare-bone.—

speaker: PRINCE
text: How now, my sweet creature of bombast? How long

speaker: PRINCE
text: is ’t ago, Jack, since thou sawest thine own knee?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My own knee? When I was about thy years,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hal, I was not an eagle’s talon in the waist. I could

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: have crept into any alderman’s thumb-ring. A

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: plague of sighing and grief! It blows a man up like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bladder. There’s villainous news abroad. Here was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Sir John Bracy from your father. You must to the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: court in the morning. That same mad fellow of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: north, Percy, and he of Wales that gave Amamon the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bastinado, and made Lucifer cuckold, and swore

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the devil his true liegeman upon the cross of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Welsh hook—what a plague call you him?

speaker: POINS
text: Owen Glendower.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Owen, Owen, the same, and his son-in-law

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Mortimer, and old Northumberland, and that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sprightly Scot of Scots, Douglas, that runs a-horseback

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: up a hill perpendicular—

speaker: PRINCE
text: He that rides at high speed, and with his pistol

speaker: PRINCE
text: kills a sparrow flying.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You have hit it.

speaker: PRINCE
text: So did he never the sparrow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, that rascal hath good mettle in him. He

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: will not run.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, what a rascal art thou then to praise him

speaker: PRINCE
text: so for running?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A-horseback, you cuckoo, but afoot he will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not budge a foot.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yes, Jack, upon instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I grant you, upon instinct. Well, he is there

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: too, and one Mordake, and a thousand blue-caps

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more. Worcester is stolen away tonight. Thy father’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: beard is turned white with the news. You may buy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: land now as cheap as stinking mackerel.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why then, it is like if there come a hot June,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and this civil buffeting hold, we shall buy maidenheads

speaker: PRINCE
text: as they buy hobnails, by the hundreds.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: By the Mass, thou sayest true. It is like we

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shall have good trading that way. But tell me, Hal,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art not thou horrible afeard? Thou being heir

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: apparent, could the world pick thee out three such

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: enemies again as that fiend Douglas, that spirit

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Percy, and that devil Glendower? Art thou not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: horribly afraid? Doth not thy blood thrill at it?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Not a whit, i’ faith. I lack some of thy instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, thou wilt be horribly chid tomorrow

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: when thou comest to thy father. If thou love me,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: practice an answer.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Do thou stand for my father and examine me

speaker: PRINCE
text: upon the particulars of my life.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
Shall I? Content. 
                He
                 
                sits
                 
                down
                .
               This chair

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shall be my state, this dagger my scepter, and this

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cushion my crown.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thy state is taken for a joined stool, thy golden

speaker: PRINCE
text: scepter for a leaden dagger, and thy precious rich

speaker: PRINCE
text: crown for a pitiful bald crown.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, an the fire of grace be not quite out of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thee, now shalt thou be moved.—Give me a cup of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sack to make my eyes look red, that it may be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thought I have wept, for I must speak in passion,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and I will do it in King Cambyses’ vein.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, here is my leg.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
And here is my speech. 
                As
                 
                King
                .
               Stand

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: aside, nobility.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O Jesu, this is excellent sport, i’ faith!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
Weep
               
              not
              ,
               
              sweet
               
              queen
              ,
               
              for
               
              trickling
               
              tears
               
              are
               
              vain
              .

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O the Father, how he holds his countenance!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
For
               
              God’s
               
              sake
              ,
               
              lords
              ,
               
              convey
               
              my
               
              tristful
               
              queen
              ,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
For
               
              tears
               
              do
               
              stop
               
              the
               
              floodgates
               
              of
               
              her
               
              eyes
              .

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O Jesu, he doth it as like one of these harlotry

speaker: HOSTESS
text: players as ever I see.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Peace, good pint-pot. Peace, good tickle-brain.—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
As
                 
                King
                .
               Harry, I do not only marvel

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: where thou spendest thy time, but also how thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art accompanied. For though the camomile, the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more it is trodden on, the faster it grows, so youth,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the more it is wasted, the sooner it wears. That

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thou art my son I have partly thy mother’s word,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: partly my own opinion, but chiefly a villainous

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: trick of thine eye and a foolish hanging of thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: nether lip that doth warrant me. If then thou be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: son to me, here lies the point: why, being son to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me, art thou so pointed at? Shall the blessed sun of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: heaven prove a micher and eat blackberries? A

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: question not to be asked. Shall the son of England

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: prove a thief and take purses? A question to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: asked. There is a thing, Harry, which thou hast

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: often heard of, and it is known to many in our land

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: by the name of pitch. This pitch, as ancient writers

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do report, doth defile; so doth the company thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: keepest. For, Harry, now I do not speak to thee in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: drink, but in tears; not in pleasure, but in passion;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not in words only, but in woes also. And yet there is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a virtuous man whom I have often noted in thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: company, but I know not his name.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What manner of man, an it like your Majesty?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A goodly portly man, i’ faith, and a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: corpulent; of a cheerful look, a pleasing eye, and a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: most noble carriage, and, as I think, his age some

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fifty, or, by ’r Lady, inclining to threescore; and now

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I remember me, his name is Falstaff. If that man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: should be lewdly given, he deceiveth me, for, Harry,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I see virtue in his looks. If then the tree may be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: known by the fruit, as the fruit by the tree, then

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: peremptorily I speak it: there is virtue in that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Falstaff; him keep with, the rest banish. And tell me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: now, thou naughty varlet, tell me where hast thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: been this month?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Dost thou speak like a king? Do thou stand for

speaker: PRINCE
text: me, and I’ll play my father.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Depose me? If thou dost it half so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gravely, so majestically, both in word and matter,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hang me up by the heels for a rabbit-sucker or a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: poulter’s hare.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, here I am set.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And here I stand.—Judge, my masters.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Now, Harry, whence come you?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My noble lord, from Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE
text: The complaints I hear of thee are

speaker: PRINCE
text: grievous.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’Sblood, my lord, they are false.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: —Nay, I’ll tickle you for a young prince, i’ faith.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Swearest thou? Ungracious boy,

speaker: PRINCE
text: henceforth ne’er look on me. Thou art violently

speaker: PRINCE
text: carried away from grace. There is a devil haunts

speaker: PRINCE
text: thee in the likeness of an old fat man. A tun of man

speaker: PRINCE
text: is thy companion. Why dost thou converse with that

speaker: PRINCE
text: trunk of humors, that bolting-hutch of beastliness,

speaker: PRINCE
text: that swollen parcel of dropsies, that huge bombard

speaker: PRINCE
text: of sack, that stuffed cloakbag of guts, that roasted

speaker: PRINCE
text: Manningtree ox with the pudding in his belly, that

speaker: PRINCE
text: reverend Vice, that gray iniquity, that father ruffian,

speaker: PRINCE
text: that vanity in years? Wherein is he good, but to taste

speaker: PRINCE
text: sack and drink it? Wherein neat and cleanly but to

speaker: PRINCE
text: carve a capon and eat it? Wherein cunning but in

speaker: PRINCE
text: craft? Wherein crafty but in villainy? Wherein villainous

speaker: PRINCE
text: but in all things? Wherein worthy but in

speaker: PRINCE
text: nothing?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would your Grace would take

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me with you. Whom means your Grace?

speaker: PRINCE
text: That villainous abominable misleader

speaker: PRINCE
text: of youth, Falstaff, that old white-bearded Satan.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: My lord, the man I know.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I know thou dost.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: But to say I know more harm in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: him than in myself were to say more than I know.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: That he is old, the more the pity; his white hairs do

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: witness it. But that he is, saving your reverence, a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: whoremaster, that I utterly deny. If sack and sugar

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: be a fault, God help the wicked. If to be old and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: merry be a sin, then many an old host that I know is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: damned. If to be fat be to be hated, then Pharaoh’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lean kine are to be loved. No, my good lord,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: banish Peto, banish Bardolph, banish Poins, but for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sweet Jack Falstaff, kind Jack Falstaff, true Jack

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Falstaff, valiant Jack Falstaff, and therefore more

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: valiant being as he is old Jack Falstaff, banish not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: him thy Harry’s company, banish not him thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Harry’s company. Banish plump Jack, and banish

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all the world.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I do, I will.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: O my lord, my lord, the Sheriff with a most

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: monstrous watch is at the door.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Out, you rogue.—Play out the play. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: much to say in the behalf of that Falstaff.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O Jesu, my lord, my lord—

speaker: PRINCE
text: Heigh, heigh, the devil rides upon a fiddlestick.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What’s the matter?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: The Sheriff and all the watch are at the door.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: They are come to search the house. Shall I let them

speaker: HOSTESS
text: in?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou hear, Hal? Never call a true piece

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of gold a counterfeit. Thou art essentially made

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: without seeming so.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And thou a natural coward without instinct.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I deny your major. If you will deny the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Sheriff, so; if not, let him enter. If I become not a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cart as well as another man, a plague on my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bringing up. I hope I shall as soon be strangled with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a halter as another.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Go hide thee behind the arras. The

speaker: PRINCE
text: rest walk up above.—Now, my masters, for a true

speaker: PRINCE
text: face and good conscience.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Both which I have had, but their date is out;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and therefore I’ll hide me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Call in the Sheriff.

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Now
              ,
               
              Master
               
              Sheriff
              ,
               
              what
               
              is
               
              your
               
              will
               
              with
               
              me
              ?

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
First
               
              pardon
               
              me
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              .
               
              A
               
              hue
               
              and
               
              cry

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
Hath
               
              followed
               
              certain
               
              men
               
              unto
               
              this
               
              house
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
What
               
              men
              ?

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
One
               
              of
               
              them
               
              is
               
              well
               
              known
              ,
               
              my
               
              gracious
               
              lord
              .

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
A
               
              gross
               
              fat
               
              man
              .

speaker: CARRIER
text:
As
               
              fat
               
              as
               
              butter
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
The
               
              man
               
              I
               
              do
               
              assure
               
              you
               
              is
               
              not
               
              here
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
For
               
              I
               
              myself
               
              at
               
              this
               
              time
               
              have
               
              employed
               
              him
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
              ,
               
              sheriff
              ,
               
              I
               
              will
               
              engage
               
              my
               
              word
               
              to
               
              thee

speaker: PRINCE
text:
That
               
              I
               
              will
               
              by
               
              tomorrow
               
              dinner
               
              time

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Send
               
              him
               
              to
               
              answer
               
              thee
               
              or
               
              any
               
              man

speaker: PRINCE
text:
For
               
              anything
               
              he
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              charged
               
              withal
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              so
               
              let
               
              me
               
              entreat
               
              you
               
              leave
               
              the
               
              house
              .

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
I
               
              will
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              .
               
              There
               
              are
               
              two
               
              gentlemen

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
Have
               
              in
               
              this
               
              robbery
               
              lost
               
              three
               
              hundred
               
              marks
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
It
               
              may
               
              be
               
              so
              .
               
              If
               
              he
               
              have
               
              robbed
               
              these
               
              men
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
He
               
              shall
               
              be
               
              answerable
              ;
               
              and
               
              so
               
              farewell
              .

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
Good
               
              night
              ,
               
              my
               
              noble
               
              lord
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
I
               
              think
               
              it
               
              is
               
              good
               
              morrow
              ,
               
              is
               
              it
               
              not
              ?

speaker: SHERIFF
text:
Indeed
              ,
               
              my
               
              lord
              ,
               
              I
               
              think
               
              it
               
              be
               
              two
               
              o’clock
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text: This oily rascal is known as well as Paul’s. Go

speaker: PRINCE
text: call him forth.

speaker: PETO
text: Falstaff!—Fast asleep behind the arras, and

speaker: PETO
text: snorting like a horse.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Hark, how hard he fetches breath. Search his

speaker: PRINCE
text: pockets.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What hast thou found?

speaker: PETO
text: Nothing but papers, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Let’s see what they be. Read them.

speaker: PETO
text:
Item
                ,
                 
                a
                 
                capon
                ,
                …
                2s
                .
                 
                2d
                .
                
                Item
                ,
                 
                sauce
                ,
                …
                4d
                .
                
                Item
                ,
                 
                sack
                ,
                 
                two
                 
                gallons
                ,
                …
                5s
                .
                 
                8d
                .
                
                Item
                ,
                 
                anchovies
                 
                and
                 
                sack
                 
                after
                 
                supper
                ,
                …
                2s
                .
                 
                6d
                .
                
                Item
                ,
                 
                bread
                ,
                …
                ob
                .

speaker: PRINCE
text: O monstrous! But one halfpennyworth of

speaker: PRINCE
text: bread to this intolerable deal of sack? What there is

speaker: PRINCE
text: else, keep close. We’ll read it at more advantage.

speaker: PRINCE
text: There let him sleep till day. I’ll to the court in the

speaker: PRINCE
text: morning. We must all to the wars, and thy place

speaker: PRINCE
text: shall be honorable. I’ll procure this fat rogue a

speaker: PRINCE
text: charge of foot, and I know his death will be a march

speaker: PRINCE
text: of twelve score. The money shall be paid back again

speaker: PRINCE
text: with advantage. Be with me betimes in the morning,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and so good morrow, Peto.

speaker: PETO
text: Good morrow, good my lord.
